burlap.behavior.singleagent

Interface MDPSolverInterface

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ModelLearningPlanner, Planner
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ActorCritic, ARTDP, AStar, BeliefSparseSampling, BestFirst, BFS, BFSRTDP, BoundedRTDP, DeterministicPlanner, DFS, DifferentiableDP, DifferentiableSparseSampling, DifferentiableVI, DynamicProgramming, DynamicProgramming.StaticVFPlanner, DynamicWeightedAStar, FittedVI, GradientDescentSarsaLam, IDAStar, LimitedMemoryDFS, LSPI, MDPSolver, PolicyIteration, PotentialShapedRMax, PrioritizedSweeping, QLearning, QLTutorial, QMDP, RTDP, SarsaLam, SparseSampling, StaticWeightedAStar, UCT, ValueIteration, VIModelLearningPlanner, VITutorial, WeightedGreedy

    public interface MDPSolverInterface
    The top-level interface for algorithms that solve MDPs. In general, classes should probably subclass the MDPSolver abstract class instead of using this interface directly, since the MDPSolver will provide relevant data members, implement these methods, and provide additional helper methods.
    Author:
    James MacGlashan.

    • Method Detail

      • solverInit

        void solverInit(Domain domain,
              RewardFunction rf,
              TerminalFunction tf,
              double gamma,
              HashableStateFactory hashingFactory)
        Initializes the solver with the common elements.
        Parameters:
        domain - the domain to be solved.
        rf - the reward function
        tf - the terminal state function
        gamma - the MDP discount factor
        hashingFactory - the hashing factory used to store states (may be set to null if the solver is not tabular)

      • resetSolver

        void resetSolver()
        This method resets all solver results so that a solver can be restarted fresh as if had never solved the MDP.

      • setDomain

        void setDomain(Domain domain)
        Sets the domain of this solver. NOTE: this will also reset the actions this solver uses to the actions of the provided domain. If you have previously added non-domain referenced actions through the addNonDomainReferencedAction(burlap.oomdp.singleagent.Action) method, you will have to do so again.
        Parameters:
        domain - the domain this solver should use.

      • getDomain

        Domain getDomain()
        Returns the Domain this solver solves.
        Returns:
        the Domain this solver solves.

      • addNonDomainReferencedAction

        void addNonDomainReferencedAction(Action a)
        Adds an additional action the solver that is not included in the domain definition. For instance, an Option should be added using this method.
        Parameters:
        a - the action to add to the solver

      • setActions

        void setActions(java.util.List<Action> actions)
        Sets the action set the solver should use.
        Parameters:
        actions - the actions the solver should use.

      • getActions

        java.util.List<Action> getActions()
        Returns a copy of all actions this solver uses for reasoning; including added actions that are not part of the domain specification (e.g., Options). Modifying the returned list will not modify the action list this solver uses.
        Returns:
        a List of all actions this solver uses.

      • getTF

        TerminalFunction getTF()
        Returns the TerminalFunction this solver uses.
        Returns:
        the TerminalFunction this solver uses.

      • getRF

        RewardFunction getRF()
        Returns the RewardFunction this solver uses.
        Returns:
        the RewardFunction this solver uses.

        Parameters:
